ch.iserver.ace.collaboration.jupiter
Class PublishedSessionImpl

java.lang.Object
  ch.iserver.ace.collaboration.jupiter.PublishedSessionImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
PublisherConnection, PublishedSession, Session, ParticipantConnection
public class PublishedSessionImpl
extends Object
implements PublishedSession, PublisherConnection

Default implementation of the PublishedSession interface.

getParticipantId

public int getParticipantId()
Description copied from interface: Session
Gets the participant id of the local user. This id uniquely identifies the user within an editing session. The participant id is available to the application mainly for informational purposes. The Session implementation will know when and how to use this id appropriately, without intervention of the application layer.

Specified by:
getParticipantId in interface Session
Returns:
the participant id of the local user
See Also:
Session.getParticipantId()

leave

public void leave()
Description copied from interface: Session
Leaves the session. After calling this method, the session becomes stale, i.e. it should not be used anymore.

Specified by:
leave in interface Session

sessionFailed

public void sessionFailed(int reason,
                          Exception e)
Description copied from interface: PublisherConnection
Called by the ServerLogic on the publisher connection when there was a failure in the server part of the published session. The server logic shuts itself down after calling this method. Thus, the published session is unusable after this method is called.

Specified by:
sessionFailed in interface PublisherConnection
Parameters:
reason - the failure code
e - the exception causing the failure
See Also:
PublisherConnection.sessionFailed(int, java.lang.Exception)

sendAcknowledge

public void sendAcknowledge(int siteId,
                            Timestamp timestamp)
Description copied from interface: ParticipantConnection
Sends an acknowledge message to the other side of the connection. The acknowledge message tells the other side the number of operations processed by the local side. This can be used to drop acknowledged messages by the other side.

Specified by:
sendAcknowledge in interface ParticipantConnection
Parameters:
siteId - the site id of the sender
timestamp - the current timestamp at the local site
See Also:
ParticipantConnection.sendAcknowledge(int, ch.iserver.ace.algorithm.Timestamp)

checkSessionState

protected final void checkSessionState()
Checks the session's state. If the session is destroyed, an IllegalStateException is thrown.

Throws:
IllegalStateException - if the session has been destroyed

lock

public void lock()
Description copied from interface: Session
Locks the session's logic so that only the calling thread can access the concurrency sensitive parts of the logic. This method must be called before any send call is invoked.

Specified by:
lock in interface Session
See Also:
Session.lock()

unlock

public void unlock()
Description copied from interface: Session
Unlocks the session's logic so that other threads may gain access to the session's logic (the operational transformation engine). Take care that every call to Session.lock() is accompanied by a exactly one call to this method.

Specified by:
unlock in interface Session
See Also:
Session.unlock()
